channel.title: Changing colors on items
channel.description:
How to change colors on items!
Step 1. Go to the client folder, look for animation.rscd unrar it and open it with wordpack. Legs1 that would maby black legs or somehting not sure. [code] <AnimationDef> <name>legs1</name> <charColour>3</charColour> <genderModel>15</genderModel> <hasA>true</hasA> <hasF>false</hasF> <number>0</number> </AnimationDef>[/code] Change Number 3 is the color now i used 65535=it was green.
[code] <charColour>3</charColour>[/code] ok now we done with one legs from the client side! step2.
go to \conf\server\defs and unRAR ItemDef.xml.gz! open again with notepack and locat to the legs lets say black legs. [code] <ItemDef> <name>Black Plate Mail Legs</name> <description>These look pretty heavy</description> <command></command> <sprite>9</sprite> <basePrice>1920</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask> </ItemDef>[/code] change the picturMask to the same color you used from befor [code] <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask>[/code] Hit save and don't forget to to replace the edit files in the client amnination and item.rscd need to be updated And voila you just changed black lext to green legs.

item.title: Changing colors on items
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

Mapu, I want a @ran@ hat too!

But seriously, can someone give some insight on this?

Read full topic

item.title: Changing colors on items
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:22, topic:259438”]How can you do this with an item that does not normally exist? The Dragon Plate for example, which comes with RSCD_v25. It is already set in the itemDef.xml.data and in the animation.xml.data files. Once you make it wieldable - it appears as rune colored no matter what decimal color you set it as. If you change the rune plate to a different decimal color then both the rune plate and the dragon plate change colors! This is not the case with the dragon 2-handed sword or the dragon battle axe, however.

Please shed some light on this for me as to how I can solve this problem.[/quote]
I don’t have figured that out yet.

mapu:

Guys make a @ran@ hat.

How whould that go

Read full topic

item.title: Changing colors on items
item.dc:creator: @froggie froggie
item.description:
@froggie wrote:

[quote=“snoopy89, post:1, topic:259438”]How to change colors on items!

Step 1.
Go to the client folder, look for animation.rscd unrar it and open it with wordpack.
Legs1 that would maby black legs or somehting not sure.

<AnimationDef> <name>legs1</name> <charColour>3</charColour> <genderModel>15</genderModel> <hasA>true</hasA> <hasF>false</hasF> <number>0</number> </AnimationDef>
Change Number 3 is the color now i used 65535=it was green.

    <charColour>3</charColour>

ok now we done with one legs from the client side!
step2.

go to \conf\server\defs and unRAR ItemDef.xml.gz!
open again with notepack
and locat to the legs lets say black legs.

<ItemDef> <name>Black Plate Mail Legs</name> <description>These look pretty heavy</description> <command></command> <sprite>9</sprite> <basePrice>1920</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask> </ItemDef>
change the picturMask to the same color you used from befor

    <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask>

Hit save and don’t forget to to replace the edit files in the client amnination and item.rscd need to be updated
And voila you just changed black lext to green legs.[/quote]

How can you do this with an item that does not normally exist? The Dragon Plate for example, which comes with RSCD_v25. It is already set in the itemDef.xml.data and in the animation.xml.data files. Once you make it wieldable - it appears as rune colored no matter what decimal color you set it as. If you change the rune plate to a different decimal color then both the rune plate and the dragon plate change colors! This is not the case with the dragon 2-handed sword or the dragon battle axe, however.

Please shed some light on this for me as to how I can solve this problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing colors on items
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

[quote=“oldskewl, post:17, topic:259438”][quote author=derek2h45 link=topic=342585.msg2705811#msg2705811 date=1236981003]
hey i just want to say i cant find my animation.rscd file. Some reason i just cant find it i also looked in my server folder im using firescape source is there a different way to do it for firescape source.
[/quote]
i think you can just move another animation.rscd file to client-conf-client, re-extract your source to get another?
on topic, this information was useful to me thanks again, got some cool new hats etc now :D[/quote]

thats where you wron.
Aminination is from the client side only, You can’t even run a server without amination.rscd you will get error on missing bla bla.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing colors on items
item.dc:creator: @snoopy89 snoopy89
item.description:
@snoopy89 wrote:

How to change colors on items!

Step 1.
Go to the client folder, look for animation.rscd unrar it and open it with wordpack.
Legs1 that would maby black legs or somehting not sure.

<AnimationDef> <name>legs1</name> <charColour>3</charColour> <genderModel>15</genderModel> <hasA>true</hasA> <hasF>false</hasF> <number>0</number> </AnimationDef>
Change Number 3 is the color now i used 65535=it was green.

    <charColour>3</charColour>

ok now we done with one legs from the client side!
step2.

go to \conf\server\defs and unRAR ItemDef.xml.gz!
open again with notepack
and locat to the legs lets say black legs.

<ItemDef> <name>Black Plate Mail Legs</name> <description>These look pretty heavy</description> <command></command> <sprite>9</sprite> <basePrice>1920</basePrice> <stackable>false</stackable> <wieldable>true</wieldable> <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask> </ItemDef>
change the picturMask to the same color you used from befor

    <pictureMask>16711748</pictureMask>

Hit save and don’t forget to to replace the edit files in the client amnination and item.rscd need to be updated
And voila you just changed black lext to green legs.
